definition[0]: used when talking about a situation and saying that it is true
example[0]: Our decision to build the museum in Hartlepool was influenced by the fact that there were no national museums in the North East.
example[1]: He refused to help me, despite the fact that I asked him several times.
example[2]: The fact we didn’t win when we were so close is very disappointing.
example[3]: Given the fact that this is their first game, I think they did pretty well.
note[0]: given the fact (that)/in view of the fact (that)
example[4]: The school’s poor exam record is largely due to the fact that it is chronically underfunded.
note[1]: due to the fact (that)/owing to the fact (that)
